text: <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> cooperates with <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> to activate HIV-1 from latently and acutely infected cells of monocyte / macrophage lineage .
<extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is elevated in HIV-1-infected individuals and has been implicated in disease progression .
In this study , we investigated the effects of <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> on the activation of HIV-1 from infected monocytes and macrophages .

Although <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> alone did not induce HIV-1 replication , in the presence of <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> markedly enhanced virion production from a chronically infected promonocytic cell line ( U1 ) and in acutely infected monocyte - derived macrophages .

Neutralizing mAbs to <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> indicated that both cytokines were essential for the induction and were required to generate a synergistic increase in virus expression .

The effects of the two cytokines were distinguishable functionally since pretreatment with <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> attenuated the cytokine cooperativity , while pretreatment with <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> potentiated their cooperativity , suggesting that <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> play different roles in the activation of virus .

Northern blot analysis as well as Ab blocking and cytokine secretion studies indicated that the induction of either endogenous <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was not involved in the cooperativity , nor was an up-regulation of TNF-alpha receptors .

text: In combination with <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> stimulated activating protein - 1 ( AP-1 ) and nuclear factor ( NF ) - kappa B binding activities and cooperated to increase HIV-1 steady-state mRNA levels and enhance long terminal repeat - directed transcription through activation of the NF-kappa B binding sites , suggesting the <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> effect occurs at least in part at the transcriptional level .

These results indicate that <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , in addition to down-regulating the cellular immune response to HIV-1 , may also play a role in <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated activation of HIV-1 replication in the monocyte / macrophage lineage .
